content.raw:
I am getting the same compile errors as those produced by jenkins:


```

/home/ian/depot/clones/gazebo-pr1057/test/performance/image_convert_stress.cc: In member function ‘virtual void ImageConvertStressTest_ManyConversions_Test::TestBody()’:
/home/ian/depot/clones/gazebo-pr1057/test/performance/image_convert_stress.cc:49:65: error: no matching function for call to ‘gazebo::common::Image::SetFromData(unsigned char (*)[], int, int, gazebo::common::Image::PixelFormat)’
/home/ian/depot/clones/gazebo-pr1057/test/performance/image_convert_stress.cc:49:65: note: candidate is:
/home/ian/depot/clones/gazebo-pr1057/gazebo/common/Image.hh:123:20: note: void gazebo::common::Image::SetFromData(const unsigned char*, unsigned int, unsigned int, gazebo::common::Image::PixelFormat)
/home/ian/depot/clones/gazebo-pr1057/gazebo/common/Image.hh:123:20: note:   no known conversion for argument 1 from ‘unsigned char (*)[]’ to ‘const unsigned char*’
In file included from /usr/include/boost/shared_ptr.hpp:17:0,
                 from /home/ian/depot/clones/gazebo-pr1057/test/performance/image_convert_stress.cc:18:
/usr/include/boost/smart_ptr/shared_ptr.hpp: In constructor ‘boost::shared_ptr<T>::shared_ptr(Y*) [with Y = unsigned char, T = unsigned char []]’:
/home/ian/depot/clones/gazebo-pr1057/test/performance/image_convert_stress.cc:41:68:   instantiated from here
/usr/include/boost/smart_ptr/shared_ptr.hpp:187:50: error: cannot convert ‘unsigned char*’ to ‘unsigned char (*)[]’ in initialization
make[2]: *** [test/performance/CMakeFiles/PERFORMANCE_image_convert_stress.dir/image_convert_stress.cc.o] Error 1
make[1]: *** [test/performance/CMakeFiles/PERFORMANCE_image_convert_stress.dir/all] Error 2

```

content.raw:
Since this fix doesn't affect API/ABI, I would recommend applying these changes to a new branch off of gazebo_2.2 or gazebo_3.0. We can then merge it forward.

@nkoenig Is it ok to add the new test to gazebo_2.2, or should we target gazebo_3.0 instead?
content.html:
Since this fix doesn't affect API/ABI, I would recommend applying these changes to a new branch off of gazebo_2.2 or gazebo_3.0. We can then merge it forward.

@nkoenig Is it ok to add the new test to gazebo_2.2, or should we target gazebo_3.0 instead?

pullrequest.title: Fix memory leak in function that converts common::Image to msgs::Image

content.raw:
Thanks for the contribution!

Would you be willing to sign [OSRF's Contributor Agreement](http://osrfoundation.org/caa.html)? More information is contained in the link.

We also like to write tests for everything. Would you be willing to write a test for this pull request? Take a look at some examples in the `gazebo/test/performance` directory. There is a function in `test/ServerFixture.hh` called `GetMemInfo` that will return memory usage info. You could write a test that calls `msgs::Set` a few times, and then check for good values of memory usage.
content.html:
Thanks for the contribution!

Would you be willing to sign OSRF's Contributor Agreement? More information is contained in the link.

We also like to write tests for everything. Would you be willing to write a test for this pull request? Take a look at some examples in the gazebo/test/performance directory. There is a function in test/ServerFixture.hh called GetMemInfo that will return memory usage info. You could write a test that calls msgs::Set a few times, and then check for good values of memory usage.

content.raw: Actually this code is not exceptoin safe. The best solution I think is to add GetData() method to common::Image that would return const unsigned char*. It woulde also more effecient (minus one image copy). Another way is to use shared_ptr.
content.html: Actually this code is not exceptoin safe. The best solution I think is to add GetData() method to common::Image that would return const unsigned char*. It woulde also more effecient (minus one image copy). Another way is to use shared_ptr.
